N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4240.7 - Business development loans

State Regulations

The corporation may provide business development loans to
small businesses and certified minority and/or women-owned business enterprises
for the acquisition or improvement of real property, machinery, equipment or
for working capital, subject to sections 4240.4 and
4240.10
of this Part and the
following: (a) an applicant for a
business development loan must have been in the business for which financing is
sought or in a related field at least three years prior to the date of its
application; (b) preference will be
given to enterprises involved in manufacturing, distribution or wholesaling; and
(c) each business development
loan provided by the corporation shall not be less than $50,000 and generally
shall not exceed $500,000. Notes
